newsitem.title: UK: IPE natural gas untraded all day as bids remain lo.
newsitem.headline: IPE natural gas untraded all day as bids remain lo.

text.p: The IPE's natural gas contract suffered its first completely blank day of the week on Thursday, with no trade done in any period.

By the close of the afternoon session only four bids were posted across various months, while only the first six months saw offers. There were only two months, July and September, when both bids and offers were seen.

Front month July was bid at 9.98 pence a therm and offered at 10.19 pence at the close after settling at 10.18 pence on Wednesday. Bids and offers had both risen slightly since the morning session, but the market remained weaker than on Wednesday while broadly tracking the physical market.
